bibl.title: Letter from Florence M. Read to Henry Rose Carter, January 5, 1924

div1.p: Read sends Carter a letter from Dr. Muench concerning yellow fever in the Guianas.

div1.head: Letter from Florence M. Read to Henry Rose Carter, January 5, 1924
div1.opener:
I. H. B.
Guianas-
ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF
----
FREDERICK F. RUSSELL, M.D.
GENERAL DIRECTOR
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE UNITED STATES
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE EAST
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE WEST INDIES
MEMBERS
----
GEORGE E. VINCENT
CHAIRMAN
WALLACE BUTTRICK
DAVID L. EDSALL
SIMON FLEXNER
RAYMOND B. FOSDICK
EDWIN O. JORDAN
VERNON KELLOGG
T. MITCHELL PRUDDEN
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
WICKLIFFE ROSE
VICTOR C. VAUGHAN
WILLIAM H. WELCH
EDWIN R. EMBREE
SECRETARY
FLORENCE M. READ
ASSISTANT SECRETARY
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
OF
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
January 5, 1924
CABLE ADDRESS “INTERCOM”
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
We are sending you for your information copy
of a letter from Doctor Muench dated December 4, 1923,
enclosing the following:
Notes on Yellow Fever in British Guiana by J.
Rodway, Esquire
Minute by Dr. E. Rowland dated December 21, 1922
Letter from W. Mearns, Esquire, to Dr. John
Haslam, Government Medical Officer of Health
Observations during the Yellow Fever Epidemic
which existed from December, 1908 to February,
1909 in Paramaribo, by Professor P. C. Flu,
Officer of Health.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Florence M. Read Doctor H. R. Carter
2121 California St., N.W.
Washington, D. C.
FMR:EP E
